text: in 2008 harvard university president
drew Faust announced that Harvard would
reduce greenhouse gas emissions thirty
percent by 2016 the Harvard Business
School sustainability program focuses on
four areas energy conservation waste
management best practices for
construction and occupant engagement
although we've added a quarter of a
million square feet to our footprint our
energy consumption is now back down to
where it was at the turn of the century
13 years ago r34 buildings 10 of them
are lead rated Harvard has 104 LEED
certified or lead registered buildings
which is more than any other university
in the world so through these efforts
including recycling composting and
source reduction Harvard Business School
has reduced its trash output by forty
six percent since 2005 when the goal was
set for Harvard to reduce its greenhouse
gas emission by thirty percent by 2016
that was a fantastic aspiration but it
was also one that seemed as it was going
to be very very hard to attain but
through lots of good work and people who
cared deeply we've achieved forty-three
percent greenhouse gas emissions and
2016 is still three years away so I want
to congratulate the harvard business
school community for having exceeded the
ambitious goals that president faust had
said for us for sustainability in our
campus I'm so proud of everything that
we've accomplished yet I know that it is
exactly at these moments that we have to
be yet more vigilant because as much as
we've accomplished it gets harder and
there's more to do we have new buildings
coming online that will require us to be
yet more energy-efficient each and every
one of us in terms of our individual
behavior still can do so much more this
is a truly important goal for us in our
community and I hope you will continue
to make every effort to make our
business school the best example of
sustainability all across Harvard so
what can you do reduce reuse and know
your recycling conserve water turn off
lights and appliances with not in use
take public transportation bike
or walk when you can report any facility
issues of the operations department for
more information contact your green team
member student sustainability associate
or visit the operations website
